memories.content:
Completed comprehensive research on migrating Verba from Weaviate to alternative databases. Key findings:

1. Current Verba Architecture:
- Heavy dependency on Weaviate for vector storage, collections, configurations
- Uses WeaviateManager class extensively throughout codebase
- Vector operations include similarity search, embedding storage, metadata management
- Component-based plugin system with managers for readers, chunkers, embedders, retrievers, generators

2. Alternative Database Capabilities:
- Supabase: Full pgvector support, production-ready vector operations, SQL compatibility
- Turso: LibSQL with vector extensions, F32_BLOB storage, lightweight edge deployment
- InstantDB: Real-time collaborative database, schema-based, but NO vector capabilities

3. Migration Complexity:
- Supabase: Medium complexity, requires refactoring WeaviateManager to PostgreSQL
- Turso: Medium-high complexity, different vector syntax and operations
- InstantDB: NOT SUITABLE - lacks vector database functionality entirely

4. Recommended approach: Supabase migration most viable due to mature pgvector ecosystem

memories.content:
LiteLLM architecture research for Verba integration completed:

## Core Architecture
- LiteLLM v1.74.15+ supports 100+ providers unified API
- OpenAI-compatible interface with async/streaming support
- Callback system for observability and logging
- Built-in cost tracking and usage monitoring

## Latest Models Support (2025)
- GPT-4.1 (54.6% on SWE-bench, 1M context)
- Claude 4 Sonnet/Opus (advanced reasoning)
- Gemini 2.5 Flash/Pro (multimodal capabilities)
- New model support via OpenRouter

## FastAPI Integration Patterns
- Async completion with `acompletion()`
- Streaming responses with `stream=True`
- WebSocket support for real-time updates
- Callback integration for middleware

## PostgreSQL Observability
- Built-in database logging support
- Custom callback system for PostgreSQL
- Spend tracking and error logging
- TimescaleDB integration for time-series data

## Key Features for Verba
- Unified API across all providers
- Async/await pattern support
- Cost tracking and monitoring
- Error handling and fallbacks
- Streaming response support

memories.content:
LiteLLM embedding models research completed:

## Supported Providers & Models
- **OpenAI**: text-embedding-3-large, text-embedding-3-small, text-embedding-ada-002
- **Cohere**: embed-english-v3.0, embed-multilingual-v3.0 (with input_type support)
- **Voyage AI**: voyage-3.5, voyage-3-large, voyage-code-3, voyage-finance-2, voyage-law-2
- **Google Vertex AI**: text-embedding-004, textembedding-gecko (+ multimodal support)
- **AWS Bedrock**: amazon.titan-embed-text-v2:0, cohere.embed-english-v3
- **HuggingFace**: Any feature-extraction model (microsoft/codebert-base, BAAI/bge-large-zh)
- **Jina AI**: jina-embeddings-v3, jina-embeddings-v2-base-en
- **Mistral**: mistral-embed

## Key Features
- Async support via `aembedding()` function
- Batch processing capabilities
- Multimodal embeddings (text + images)
- Provider-specific parameters (input_type, dimensions, task_type)
- Cost tracking and observability
- PostgreSQL callback integration support

## Integration Patterns
- Unified API across all providers: `embedding(model="provider/model", input=["text"])`
- Async pattern: `await aembedding(model="...", input=[...])`
- Proxy support for centralized model management
- Custom callbacks for database logging
